googleSheetVaApiDataRow.earlyVotingNotes: Early voting for the presidential election begins 15 days before the election, although voters can request a ballot in-person starting 30 days before the election.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmNotes: CO is all VBM. So long as your voter registration is received by 8 days before an election, a ballot will be mailed automatically.  CO still offers one-time absentee ballots, though, for folks who have a temporary mailing address.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Bring your Colorado driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox6: Provide your Colorado  driver’s license number or identification number. If you do not have either of these numbers, provide the last 4 digits of your social security number. If you do not have any of these numbers, write "NONE" in this space.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules:
* All Colorado elections are held by mail.  
* You can still request a one-time absentee ballot if you will be away from home during a specific election.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfSubmissionAddress:
Colorado Secretary of State  
1700 Broadway, Suite 200  
Denver, CO 80290
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsInPersonVoting: All Colorado voters need to show ID if they vote in person.  Acceptable forms of photo-ID include a Colorado drivers license, a Colorada state ID card, a US passport, a photo ID issued by any Colorado government agency, a photo ID issued by any federal agency, a military ID card, a veteran's ID card, a student ID from an accredited Colorado college or university, or a tribal ID card.  Acceptable forms of non-photo ID include a recent utility bill, bank statement, government check, paycheck, or other government document that shows your current name and address. Colorado will also accept a birth certificate or a certified naturalization document.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmWarnings: The Local Election Office will compare your signature on your voted ballot to the one on your driver’s license.  If the signatures don't match, your ballot might be rejected.  Please sign carefully.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmApplicationDirections:
* All Colorado elections are held by mail.  This means that Colorado will automatically send a mail-in ballot to every **registered** voter for the November 3, 2020 election.  
* If you need to update your mailing address **permanently**, [register to vote again](http://www.voteamerica.com/register-to-vote/) using your new mailing address. 
* If you need to update your mailing address **temporarily** -- because you will be out of town for the November 3, 2020 election --  [request a one-time absentee ballot](http://www.voteamerica.com/absentee-ballot/).
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox7: You may register with a party. If you leave this section blank you will not be registered with any party.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsOvr: You will need a Colorado driver's license or state ID to register to vote online.  If you don't have ID, you can register to vote by mail or in person.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsVbm: Colorado voters do not need to provide ID when voting by mail.
